message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of temperature on muscle function in animals. Low temperatures in single digits can cause trembling muscle spasms in animals. Option (B) is incorrect because high temperatures in triple digits can lead to heat exhaustion or heat stroke, but not trembling muscle spasms. Option (C) is incorrect because it does not specify any particular temperature range that would cause muscle spasms. Option (D) is incorrect because being unaware of the temperature would not directly cause muscle spasms.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of temperature on muscles in animals. Trembling muscle spasms, also known as shivering, are a response to cold temperatures. When animals are exposed to temperatures in single digits (option A), their muscles contract and relax rapidly to generate heat and maintain body temperature. Option B, temperatures in triple digits, is incorrect because high temperatures do not typically cause muscle spasms. Option C, finding the right temperatures, is also incorrect because the question is asking about a specific cause, not a temperature range. Option D, being unaware of the temperature, is unrelated to the physiological response of muscle spasms.
